alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:49PM CDT until August 05 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Lyon County in northwestern Iowa... Central Sioux County in northwestern Iowa... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 549 PM CDT, Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sioux Center, Orange City, Rock Valley and Maurice. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
